title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)
description: With vines in the south of the Vinho Verde region, the estate has wines with a warm, ripe character. This example shows a richer side of Vinho Verde while preserving the natural crisp edge. Tropical fruits are balanced with a citrus aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Casarena 2011 Lauren's Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)
description: A heavily charred nose puts a burnt crust on top of earthy, savory red-berry aromas. This feels big and blocky. Savory, salty red-fruit flavors live under a heavy oak blanket, while char and burnt-meat flavors linger on the finish.

title: Cavalier Bartolomeo 2012 Altenasso  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of leather, stewed prune, underbrush and a whiff of game lead the nose. The solid, straightforward palate offers Marasca cherry, sage and a licorice note alongside tightly wound tannins that grip the finish.

title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: From vines in the north of the Nuits Saint-Georges, close to Vosne-Romanée, this is a structured wine. It has ripe berry fruits and acidity that are still developing through the firm, dry tannins. The wine is still young and needs to age, so drink from 2019.

title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2014  Mâcon-Davayé
description: Full and ripe, this wine also has good acidity that gives a lively edge to the yellow-fruit flavors. Along with the peach and apricot fruits, it presents refreshing crispness. The aftertaste delivers a great lift of acidity.

title: Domaine de Suremain 2014  Mercurey
description: This wine is smoky yet fresh and juicy. It has a light touch of red-currant fruits, a crisp texture and bright acidity. The tannins are gentle, leaving pride of place to the natural fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, spicy plum and berry aromas are racy and a touch leathery. Grabby tannins make for a drawing mouthfeel, while this tastes of herbal plum and wild berry along with chocolate and mint. A dry, lightly oaked but spicy finish provides for a good ending.

title: Calera 2014 Viognier (Central Coast)
description: Coming entirely from Gimelli Vineyard in San Benito County, this bottling, which is aged in neutral oak and concrete, shows squeezed Meyer lemon, Gravenstein apple, rain on slate minerality and key lime pie on the nose, which balances citrus with minerality. The palate is rather light and fresh, with cement, squeezed lime and yellow apple skin flavors.

title: Alta Vista 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Dark, minty and fiery on first take, this folds in aromas of licorice and oaky lemon peel along with spicy berry fruit. Firm and tightly built, this is spicy, peppery and chocolaty on a canvas of berry and cassis. Powerful, toasty and a touch hot on the finish.

title: Béres 2011 Locse Furmint (Tokaj)
description: Aromas of vanilla, toasted almond and white-peach juice prepare your palate for flavors of citrus blossom, apricot and pear. The finish has crisp acidity and pronounced minerality.

title: Boffa 2013 Ovello  (Barbaresco)
description: Baking spice, blue flower, exotic spice and a hint of game slowly emerge on this. The approachable palate offers ripe black cherry, fig, cinnamon and a hint of pipe tobacco alongside rounded tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Nada Fiorenzo 2012 Manzola  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of new leather, iris, ripe berry, baking spice and a balsamic note of menthol come together on this. On the palate, notes of clove and star anise accent a core of ripe Marasca cherry and crushed raspberry. Fine-grained tannins provide the framework.

title: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Moscato (Lodi)
description: Delicious and very sweet, this comes off as a tempting dessert wine rather than a cocktail drink. It has deep peach flavors, almond nuances, a layered and creamy texture and lingering finish.

title: Oddero 2010 Bussia Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This offers aromas of oak, vanilla, camphor and grilled herbs along with a whiff of cherry liqueur. On the palate, coffee, sage and balsamic notes accent a core of steeped black cherries. Extremely astringent tannins grip the finish.

title: Palladino 2012 Parafada  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas that recall cellar floor, underbrush, toast and espresso. The palate is primary, offering raspberry compote, licorice and grilled sage alongside youthfully austere tannins that clench the finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2013 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)
description: The cool character of this under-rated appellation is apparent in this red-currant-dominated wine. With a fresh streak of acidity, the wood and spice flavors are contained and balanced. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Tapiz 2015 Alta Collection Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Floral and dusty on the nose, this Chardonnay is racy, fruity and fairly full in body. Melon and citrus flavors are big but clean, and not much differs on the finish. Overall, this is juicy, bright and full of fruit.

title: Louis Latour 2014  Aloxe-Corton
description: From the Louis Latour domaine, this rich wine is lightly touched with wood. It has red-plum flavors and ripe acidity, with the structure embedded in the fruits. Drink from 2019.

title: Louis Latour 2014  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: Ripe and fruity with a velvet texture that encompasses the tannins easily, this is a rounded, rich wine. The balance of fruit and acidity is already attractive. Drink from 2018.

title: Love & Squalor 2014 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: Some hints of diesel spark up the nose, along with a wash of honeycomb. This is densely flavorful, with apple, lemon, mint, cracker and white pepper components punching through. Buoyed by ample acidity, and lightly touched with a hint of residual sugar, this potent wine puts boxing gloves on Riesling and goes for the TKO. That said, it is not a wine to cellar, but rather to drink up quickly and enjoy its quirky power.

title: Luigi Bosca 2014 Gala 3 Viognier-Chardonnay-Riesling White (Mendoza)
description: This blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Riesling is challenging but rewarding. Funky, pickled stone-fruit aromas are not textbook and pure. In the mouth, this is firm and stout for a white wine, while salty, briny nectarine and apricot flavors finish full and serious.

title: Porto Reccua Vinhos NV Tell's Reserva Especial  (Port)
description: The wine shows some good barrel aging to give a lightly woody character with acidity and raisin flavors. It is dry, perfumed with spice and properly mature.

title: Quady North 2015 Rosé of Grenache (Rogue Valley)
description: Peaches and rosewater are the dominant flavors in this tasty, all Grenache rosé. Though it comes across as a bit one dimensional, that dimension has plenty of fruity appeal, supported with lemony acids and a hint of bitter rind.

title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Calçada Terroir Alvarinho (Minho)
description: From vineyards in the southern section of Vinho Verde, this ripe Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a light texture that is balanced with crisp acidity and a juicy, perfumed aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Piero Busso 2012 Albesani  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with earthy aromas that recall leafy underbrush, leather, stewed prune, toasted hazelnut and dark baking spice aromas. The firm, tightly wound palate shows dried black cherry, clove and bracing tannins that leave a somewhat raspy finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink.

title: Pierre Vessigaud 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Lively and fresh, this wine offers apples, citrus and warmer pears. The juicy fruitiness is immediately attractive, perfumed and bright at the end. Drink now.

title: Pietro Rinaldi 2013 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting resin, overripe plum, raisin, menthol and a whiff of nail polish remover. The palate shows tart cranberry, star anise and a hint of dark baking spice alongside assertive, close-grained tannins leave an astringent finish. You'll also notice the slight warmth of alcohol on the finish.

title: Gemma 2012  Barolo
description: This opens with earthy aromas of truffle, leather, leafy underbrush and a hint of blue flower. The ripe accessible palate offers raspberry jam, vanilla, chocolate and a hint of licorice framed in velvety tannins. It ends on a note that recalls soy sauce.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: This wine is full of potential. With a lively texture and ripe yellow and pear fruit flavors, it has weight and an attractive richness. It finishes with tangy, tight acidity that will allow it to age. Drink from 2017.

title: Giacomo Grimaldi 2012 Le Coste  (Barolo)
description: Enticing floral aromas of rose, purple flower, berry and chopped mint float out of the glass. The palate isn't as expressive as the nose, offering raw red cherry, anise, and powdered sage alongside astringent tannins.
